page.title: 07FARMING-A TYPICAL FARM
page.content:
WESTWOOD HOME FARM
WESTWOOD HOME FARM IS VERY CLOSE TO GREAT HORKESLEY,AND HAS BEEN FARMED FOR OVER FIFTY YEARS.ITS OWNERS MR AND MRS BROWN GROW CROPS AND KEEP ANIMALS. THEY OWN FIFTY FRESIAN COWS,PRODUCING 6 GALLONS OF MILK A DAY.THERE ARE ALSO 20 BULLS,50 SHEEP,AND 32 LAMBS AT THE PRESENT MOMENT.THE ANIMALS FEED AND ROAM ABOUT IN ABOUT 60 ACRES OF GRASSLAND.THERE ARE 100 ACRES OF WHEAT FARMED,60 ACRES OF BARLEY,20 ACRES OF SUGAR BEAT,20 ACRES OF PEAS,10 ACRES OF LINT SEED,AND 22 ACRES OF MAIZE THE FARM HAS 5 TRACTORS,A VERY OLD COMBINE HARVESTER,AND FOUR TRAILERS. THE FARMER HAS 5 LABOURERS WHO WORK FOR HIM,BUT WHO LIVE ELSEWHERE.THEY START WORK AT FIVE OCLOCK,AND FINISH AT EIGHT OCLOCK IN THE EVENING IN THE SUMMER MONTHS.
